comment: Dr. Randolph was an amazing professor. She was very accessible outside of class and had some extra credit to equate for an unavailable assignment. The tests were lockdown with book availability and webcam.

Amazing professor.There is a reason her course is taken early in the MSIS and as a pre-req. She has wealth of knowlege to share with her students to make them both successful in the rest of the program and in industry. She helps build your confidence to be in the program.She really invests in her students to help them grow inside and outside class.

TAKE Professor Randolph for online IS3100! You WILL not regret it. Weekly discussions and quizzes. Four exams BUT nothing is on lockdown so resources are highly encouraged. Group Project is completely doable as long as your participate. One of the easiest classes I've taken at KSU. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor! Made learning easy. Multiple choice exams and weekly quizzes were straight from the chapter. Two discussion post a week that were easy to understand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: I loved this class! Discussion posts and quizzes weekly, four tests, and 2 group projects with team members of your choosing. She clearly wants you to succeed.

Take this professor. Easy A. Just do the discussions and quizzes every week. Exams and quizzes are really easy if you know what I mean. Only need book for certain discussion posts, but they are graded easy. One group project. We all did what was necessary and made a 100 on it. Take fr.
Just take her, trust me. You wont regret it.

Dr. Randolph is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Fun, engaging, likes teaching her class, even people who don't have an IS-background can come in and feel like they're excited to get into the subject. If you have the choice, take her!

She's one of the nicest and best professor's I've taken at KSU. There's a discussion post due each week with an online quiz as well. Both are extremely easy. You also have exams that are given via D2L. She's incredibly passionate about Information Systems and always makes the class discussions interesting. I would 100% take her again.
Dr. Randolph is a solid choice for IS 3100. Her class makes it easier to enjoy learning about IS. Just do the assignments, and an A is more than attainable!

Professor Randolph is a good choice. A group project and paper goes on for the majority of the semester, but that's the hardest part. Tests are online. No extra credit, but you don't really need it. There is online HW in the form of discussions on D2L, but it's really easy. Just do it. Online quizzes with unlimited attempts.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Randolph makes everything clear up front and is available to discuss via D2L if needed. Grading criteria is very clear. There are chapters to read and quizzes each week, along with a quick discussion topic. The group project is started early on so you do not feel rushed. She is very understanding and grades fairly. I would take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Great professor! Do the work, pass the class. Hardest part about the class was replying on my knuckle-head teammates to come through on our group project. Complete weekly discussions on time and 4 exams throughout the semester.

Pretty easy online class if you keep up with the homework. Took it online. Consists of weekly discussion posts, weekly chapter quizzes, 4 tests, 5 #iseng events, and a group project. Let's you pick your own group, so do it early. Recommend doing the events early too!

I took this class online and it was somewhat unorganized. The weekly quizzes covered random things related to IS but not to the specific chapters. The group project is due early in the semester to make the end of the semester lighter, which is great. She's an easy grader on discussions. Unlimited quiz attempts and tests are not hard.

Professor Randolph was an awesome professor. She genuinely cares about her students and is always willing to talk and help outside of class. Since it was a discussion based class the criteria wasn't too demanding, but there was a significant amount of reading. Overall, I would take her again. Amazing professor!
Was the easiest class I have ever taken! She is a VERY lenient when it comes to grading. She is one of those professors that does not make a course harder than what it needs to be.

Easy A class. She is fair in grading. States 2 post grades every 2 wks but took longer. Isn't active on D2L. However, she is very nice and loves what she does. Unlimited quizzes til u get 100%, 3 exams & group project.
Very easy A. I wish I have her for all my classes.

Excellent professor.  There is a team project that is due around the middle of the semester.  This is very helpful if you have other classes where the team projects are due at the end of the semester.  No Final Exam.  All exams are open book and open notes and you must be present in the class room when taking the exam eventhoug the exams are online

Excellent professor.  Very knowledgable about the subject.  Some of the material could be very dry but she keeps it interesting.  Be sure to participate in class discussions.  There is a team project that is due around the middle of the semester which helped me out with other classes team projects that were due at the end of the semester.
Dr. Randolph is AMAZING. She is so nice and very helpful. If you give some effort, easy A. TAKE HER!

Although I feel that both BISM classes I've taken were a waste of time, this professor is great! Makes class as interesting as it can be and she class every single day up until the day she gave birth (which happened to be on our last test day!). Great professor and great student driven discussions.
Professor Randolph is amazing. Though 8+ weeks pregnant she was able to make it to class every day and made the classes interesting and fun.

After the 1st exam, class goes downhill. Second test is nothing but acronyms. All tests open book/open notes/powerpoint, but still difficult. 5 point quizzes on vista everyday for attendance purposes, but don't even think about trying to take it when you aren't in class. She will catch you. Overall she is nice.

Professor Randolph is a very very good teacher. Yes we have quizzes every day . But they were like 5 questions and you could use your notes. The test were not that hard if you read the notes and the book. She makes it very interactive so its not boring. You have a project .. so do good in it (it well help your grade) Study and Easy A or B

Quizzes EVERY single day. She doesn't answer questions on vista. Tests are hard and materials on tests on not taught, generally. Does not allow computers even to take notes. She even pulled me aside to ask me why I left class early one day- very nosey! Does not give clear instructions on any assignments. Just bad overall.
Great teacher.  She has a lot to offer and is great at what she does.

Professor Randolph was so sweet and tried to make class as interesting as bism 3100 can be.  She encorporated funny videos into her lectures.  The class was simple, occasional quizzes in the beginning of the semester, tests, 2 case studies, and a project.  It was all very simple though. Definitely recommended! She's a sweetie.
Wonderful professor! Keeps class interesting. You do have to go to class though; she takes attendance. One group project (choose your team wisely), 3 tests, no final.

She is a great professor for such a boring subject. I never really paid attention in class because I was bored, never read the book and still passed with an A. The tests are open book and notes, so as long as you know where stuff is you should do just fine.
No Comments
